# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    lowercase!(col)  # Lowercase the string
    col = lstrip(col)  # Strip leading whitespaces
    col = rstrip(col)  # Strip trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")  # Replace spaces with underscore
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")  # Replace hyphens with underscore
    return col
end

# Testing the function with provided data
col = "My Column"
clean_column(col) # Should return "my_column"
```
This code defines a function `clean_column` that takes a column name as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. The function is then tested with the provided data.
